text: Cadmium iodide is a chemical compound. Its chemical formula is CdI2. It has cadmium and iodide ions in it. ==Properties== Cadmium iodide is a white or pale yellow solid. It is known for its crystal structure. Many other chemical compounds have a cadmium iodide crystal structure. It easily dissolves in water. It is toxic. ==Preparation== It is made by reacting cadmium with iodine. It can also be made by reacting cadmium, or cadmium oxide with hydriodic acid. ==Uses== Cadmium iodide is used to make phosphors (things that light when struck by UV light), photography, and electroplating. ==Related pages== *Cadmium chloride *Cadmium fluoride *Cadmium bromide *Mercury iodide Category:Cadmium compounds Category:Iodine compounds
title: Cadmium iodide
